data.title: YG – The Xclusive List
data.text:
Hip Hop TXL Pays Tribute to Trouble. Hip Hop suffered another loss due to violence with the death of Trouble. Trouble was an artist out of ATL who released his debut project “December 17th’ in 2011 and had since to be one of the profound voices out of the Atlanta Hip Hop scene. TXL 50 …

TXL 50: LONG LIVE TROUBLE Read More »

The project features Day Sulan, D3szn and more. YG’s 4Hunnid label has dropped a compilation album showcasing it’s artists that are quickly on the rise. Check out the video for the single off the project ‘Hit Em Up’ below: 4Hunnid Presents: Gang Affiliated is now available for streaming on all platforms.

“Savage Mode” 21 Savage makes a triumphant return. The 28th TXL mixtape dropped this weekend, featuring 21 Savage on the cover. The heavy-hitting Atlanta rapper is coming fresh off the release of his latest album and collaboration with Metro Boomin, Savage Mode II. The long awaited project is #1 on music streaming services, and being …

TXL 28 Read More »

Wiz is still bringing the smoothest sounds to the streets. The Hip Hop TXL crew comes back with more heat following last week’s TXL 26 release with TXL 27. Featuring Wiz Khalifa on the cover, TXL 27 features some of the latest tracks and features from the Pittsburgh rapper, who is surely having a good …

TXL 27 Read More »

Big Sean shows out on TXL 26 with his newest music. The 26th volume in the TXL series dropped this weekend, hosted by DJ Reddy Rell, DJ Pareece and DJ Iceberg. The latest playlist features Big Sean on the cover, who is fresh off the release of his latest album Detroit 2. Big Sean brings …

TXL 26 Read More »

Yo Gotti continues to bring the heat in 2020. The 23rd volume in the TXL series dropped this weekend, featuring Yo Gotti on the cover. The tape is hosted by DJ Reddy Rell, DJ Iceberg, and Adrian Swish. Yo Gotti is coming fresh off the release of his latest single and video “Recession Proof”, where …

TXL 23 Read More »

YG and other artists pay tribute to George Floyd and the fight for justice through music. TXL 22 has been released, and comes at a time where society is experiencing a high level of unrest and turmoil. Due to this, artists have used their platform to express the frustration, anger, and injustice of law enforcement …

TXL 22 Read More »

The Compton rapper, Black Lives Matter, and Build Power joined forces on Sunday to pull out a huge crowd in Los Angeles. This Sunday more than 50,000 people pulled up to Hollywood Blvd for a peaceful demonstration. The protest was lead by YG, Patrisse Cullors, and Kendrick Sampson to protest racism and the police system. …

YG x BLM x BLDPWR Make History Read More »

TXL 19 pays tribute to Fred The Godson. The nineteenth installment of the TXL series has been released and is filled with the latest bangers and exclusives from Hip Hop’s finest. The tape is hosted by DJ Reddy Rell (@DJReddyRell) DJ Iceberg (@TheDJIceberg) and DJ Pareece (@DJPAREECE) The tape pays tribute to Bronx rapper Fred …

TXL 19 Read More »

One week into the new decade and a lot has happened already. But rest assured that whenever there is havoc in the world you can always count on some dope bars and great production to help ease the ride. With that being said Peace Smith (@peacesmith_), co-owner of Hip Hop TXL, takes a quick flashback …

Hip Hop TXL Top 10 Albums of 2019 Read More »
